properties.description: The Darwin Core Type Vocabulary extends the DCMI Type Vocabulary and provides a list of approved values that may be used for the basisOfRecord term to identify the specific type of a resource. For term descriptions see: http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/type-vocabulary/index.htm
properties.title: Type

properties.description: A language of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 [RFC4646].
properties.title: Language

properties.default_value: This material is provided for research, education, and private use only.
properties.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
properties.title: Rights Holder

properties.description: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
properties.title: Access Rights

properties.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.
properties.title: Institution Code

properties.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.
properties.title: collectionCode

properties.description: A descriptive term indicating whether the record represents an object or observation. Term definitions are available here: http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/DarwinCore/BasisOfRecord
properties.title: Basis of Record

properties.description: The category of information pertaining to evidence of an occurrence in nature, in a collection, or in a dataset (specimen, observation, etc.).
properties.title: Occurrence terms

properties.description: An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.
properties.title: Occurrence ID

properties.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.
properties.title: Catalogue Number

properties.description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.
properties.title: Occurrence Remarks

properties.description: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.
properties.title: Recorded Number

properties.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.
properties.title: Recorded By

properties.description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E). Examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC.
properties.title: Event Date

properties.description: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.
properties.title: Year

properties.description: The ordinal month in which the Event occurred. Examples: "1" (=January)
properties.title: Month

properties.description: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred. Example: "9"
properties.title: Day

properties.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred. Example: "marsh"
properties.title: Habitat

properties.description: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.
properties.title: Field Number

properties.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.
properties.title: Field Notes

properties.description: Comments or notes about the Event.
properties.title: Event Remarks

properties.description: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names or the ISO 3166 Continent code. Ideally this would be a select field.
properties.title: Continent

properties.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.
properties.title: Country

properties.description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes.
properties.title: Country Code

properties.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.
properties.title: State / Province

properties.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.
properties.title: County

properties.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.
properties.title: Municipality

properties.description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.
properties.title: Locality

properties.description: The original textual description of the place.
properties.title: Verbatim Locality

properties.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
properties.title: Decimal Latitude

properties.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
properties.title: Decimal Longitude

properties.description: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. This ideally would be a lookup.
properties.title: Taxon ID

properties.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.
properties.title: Sceintific Name

properties.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified. Ideally this would we a select field.
properties.title: Kingdom

properties.description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.
properties.title: Phylum

properties.description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.
properties.title: Class

properties.description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.
properties.title: Order

properties.description: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.
properties.title: Family

properties.description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.
properties.title: Genus

properties.description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.
properties.title: Subgenus

properties.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.
properties.title: Specific Epithet

properties.description: A common or vernacular name.
properties.title: Vernacular Name

properties.description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.
properties.title: Taxon Remarks
